items.title: Code.gov Administration Tool for Agency Inventory Upload and Maintenance
items.description:
Issue Description:
This task supports the Code.gov team. We have an admin tool prototype and want to bring it to production for agency use. There is both a front-end web interface and a database.

Specific tasks:

Get the current prototype admin tool working. Front-end repo here - https://github.com/GSA/code-gov-admintool; Back-end repo here - https://github.com/GSA/code-gov-admin-backend.
Work with the Code.gov team and me (Joe Castle) to determine path forward for production. This includes integration with Code.gov, including the environment with security, CI, code scanning, databases, etc.
Contact Info:
Name: Joseph Castle
Email: joseph.castle@gsa.gov

items.title: Labor Hours Estimation for Code.gov Open Source Repositories
items.description:
Issue Description:
This task supports the Code.gov team. We want to estimate total lines of code and total hours and costs for the code that is located in all of our open source repositories. The open source repositories are listed in the agency json files as shown on Code.gov.

Specific tasks:

Count total lines of code for all open source repos on Code.gov using CLOC - https://github.com/AlDanial/cloc.
Determine labor hours and costs of total lines of code using the COCOMO II Model - http://csse.usc.edu/tools/cocomoii.php. Parameters TBD and can work with me (Joe Castle) on this.
Provide all of this in a program/script that can be run on a regular basis to account for new code as it is added to Code.gov
Contact Info:
Name: Joseph Castle
Email: joseph.castle@gsa.gov

items.title: Allow rename during duplicate
items.description: It would be nice to give the opportunity to rename when creating the copy, rather than having to create the copy and then go into properties to edit the name.

items.title: Allow user to view an item from the left pane while editing
items.description:
Issue Description:
When editing, a very common observation is users single-clicking an object in the left pane (both browse tree and search) and being taken out of Edit mode, or being warned with the 'Unsaved changes' dialog. What they want is to be able to see an object before adding it to a thing they're currently editing.

Proposed solution:

Single-clicking in the left pane during Edit mode displays the clicked object in an overlay without taking the user out of Edit mode.
All normal 'view' functionality (like plot pan/zoom) would be available.
There should be a 'Add This Item' button available in the overlay as well that would add the item being viewed to the object being edited, then closes the overlay.

items.title: Add 'Create..' Option to create object inside other object.
items.description: It should be possible for a user to right click on an object in the tree view and select 'create...' to create an object inside of that object. This option should not exist for objects that do not have composition.

items.title: Remove action is available for non-editable objects
items.description: Attempting to use the action fails as expected, but it probably shouldn't be available in the first place. This is evident in the live demo. Navigate to a non-editable layout (eg. anything under 'demo objects'). The context menu on any of the objects in the layout includes the remove action.

items.title: Timers aren't visually indicating countdown or countup
items.description: Timers should display + or - depending on whether they are counting up or down. This is a regression error, they used to do this.

items.title: Various error messages in tables
items.description: The table component can sometimes produce various errors when the view changes (eg. on save, on navigation away etc.).

items.title: Wait spinner shows longer than necessary
items.description: During testing of VISTA R3.4 RC1, repeatedly noticed wait spinners sticking around after new data had become visible in the plot. Clicking on a splitter bar between panes causes the wait spinner to disappear, leading me to believe that we need an $apply call somewhere.

items.title: Y Axis disappears when deeply zoomed
items.description: Steps to reproduce:Create a plot containing a telemetry element, Zoom in on data repeatedly, looking at Y-Axis, Observe: Eventually Y Axis disappears and a console error is shown

items.title: Elements pool doesn't get updated after removing an object
items.description: In Layout, try removing an object via the context menu by right clicking the object in the elements pool. Notice the object remains listed in the elements pool.

items.title: Allow Angular components as Interfaces
items.description: Currently Interfaces are limited to relatively simple JS (or whatever plugin libraries are loaded by the interface). It would be very nice to be able to just add an additional component and somehow load it into the main module (or add in a new app module just for this), so interface developers can utilize Angular functionality to make writing interfaces easier (and better utilize our apis).

items.title: Split up the App API JSON Schema into multiple files
items.description: Currently the App API JSON Schema in data/walkoff_schema.json is about 1000 lines long and is getting a bit bloated and hand to maintain. It would be better if it is split up into manageable files and placed in its own directory inside data. This should only involve using the {'#ref' : '../path/to/new/file'} feature of JSON schemas (see this issue here: Julian/jsonschema#98). This may also involve a teak in core.config.config depending on the reference resolver being used and possibly a change to core.config.paths if the path to the schema changes.

items.title: client-side dependency installation support for interfaces
items.description: Currently, there is no clean way to install client dependencies for custom interfaces. If the install_dependencies.py script could look for a package.json file in the interfaces and run npm install in that directory, then this issue would be resolved

items.title: requirements.txt support in custom interfaces
items.description: Custom interfaces may require additional dependencies, but currently, there is no straightforward mechanism to install them like there is for app dependencies. The install dependencies script could be modified to install dependencies for apps as well as interfaces

items.title: Request: parameter to start on a specific module
items.description: We would love to be able to create bookmarklets that take us directly to a specific module, like Tables or Links. We have a set of bookmarklets shared by the team, organized by what they're used for, so it would be great to point someone directly to a specific module. We would love a parameter we can pass in the URL that selects the starting module.

items.title: Double border in footer links at mobile
items.description: When at mobile size the links in the footer stack on top of each other. Since it's three columns at desktop sizes, the three stacked columns end up with double borders between each stacked column. This is visible after the 'Open Government' and 'Tribal' link.

items.title: Protractor parameters are not including text after spaces
items.description: Try gulp test:acceptance --platform='OS X 10.9' --sauce and this line will have platform set to OS, not the full string with spaces, which leads to a Sauce error since the OS version is not specified.

items.title: Sauce window dimensions are not being set
items.description: Running tests on sauce shows up undefined,undefinedpx because this reference does not exist anymore https://github.com/cfpb/cfgov-refresh/blob/master/test/browser_tests/conf.js#L169-L170.

items.title: State OR Region?
items.description: As currently designed, the site lets me think I can search for, say, schools in Virginia in the region of New England. Seems to me if I choose a state, the site should eliminate region as an additional option.

items.title: AnnotationAttributes interface alignment
items.description: Evaluate AnnotationAttributes in light of the patterns established by ShapeAttributes and PlacemarkAttributes. Identify and resolve inconsistent patterns. We know of one property that breaks with the established attributes convention: AnnotationAttributes.opacity. This value is expressed in the attributes' alpha channel.

items.title: TectonicPlatesLayer plate geometries are drawn incorrectly
items.description: The TectonicPlatesLayer plate geometries are drawn with SurfacePolygon, yet the source geometry for each plate is a WKT LineString. The geometry should be drawn with SurfacePolyline.

items.title: Add a method for cleanly unregistering window controllers
items.description: With the new controller design, apps have the freedom to replace the default BasicWorldWindController with one of their own choosing. However, replacing the controller will currently leave dangling GestureRecognizer references (and perhaps others) hanging around, so we need to add a method of gracefully unregistering a controller and registering a new one that does proper clean up.
